title: Tableau Developer - People Analytics
description:
**Who we are**



Samsara (NYSE: IOT) is the pioneer of the Connected Operations™ Cloud, which is a platform that enables organizations that depend on physical operations to harness Internet of Things (IoT) data to develop actionable insights and improve their operations. At Samsara, we are helping improve the safety, efficiency and sustainability of the physical operations that power our global economy. Representing more than 40% of global GDP, these industries are the infrastructure of our planet, including agriculture, construction, field services, transportation, and manufacturing — and we are excited to help digitally transform their operations at scale.



Working at Samsara means you'll help define the future of physical operations and be on a team that's shaping an exciting array of product solutions, including Video-Based Safety, Vehicle Telematics, Apps and Driver Workflows, Equipment Monitoring, and Site Visibility. As part of a recently public company, you'll have the autonomy and support to make an impact as we build for the long term.


**Recent awards we've won include:**



Glassdoor's Best Places to Work 2024



Best Places to Work by Built In 2024



Great Place To Work Certified™ 2023



Fast Company's Best Workplaces for Innovators 2023



Financial Times The Americas' Fastest Growing Companies 2023



We see a profound opportunity for data to improve the safety, efficiency, and sustainability of operations, and hope you consider joining us on this exciting journey.

**About the role:**



We're looking for a highly skilled Tableau Developer for our People Business Operations & Analytics team. This is a great role for a creative problem solver who wants to have a big impact on the future of Samsara. This role will work directly with leaders in our People Experience and Recruiting organization to define metrics and reporting, provide analytical support, develop mechanisms to inspect efficiency, and play a crucial role in developing our analytical forecasting capabilities. This person will be responsible for ensuring our leaders have access to the accurate, quality data that drives decision-making across the organization.



This role is open to candidates residing in Canada and the US except Alaska, Austin metro, California, Chicago metro, Connecticut, Dallas metro, Denver metro, Houston metro, Maryland, Massachusetts, New Jersey, New York, Rhode Island, Washington, and Washington DC metro.


**You should apply if:**


* **You want to impact the industries that run our world:** Your efforts will result in real-world impact—helping to keep the lights on, get food into grocery stores, reduce emissions, and most importantly, ensure workers return home safely.
* **You are the architect of your own career:** If you put in the work, this role won't be your last at Samsara. We set up our employees for success and have built a culture that encourages rapid career development, and countless opportunities to experiment and master your craft in a hyper growth environment.
* **You're energized by our opportunity:** The vision we have to digitize large sectors of the global economy requires your full focus and best efforts to bring forth creative, ambitious ideas for our customers.
* **You want to be with the best:** At Samsara, we win together, celebrate together and support each other. You will be surrounded by a high-caliber team that will encourage you to do your best.


*Click here* *to learn about what we value at Samsara.*


#### **In this role, you will:**


* Create compelling visualizations and reports using Tableau and other tools to communicate findings and insights to business leaders.
* Perform data and trend analysis to track Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and inform strategic decision-making for Samsara Leadership.
* Analyze and interpret large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
* Drive the collection of new data; improve and refine existing data sources through automation. Drive projects to improve data quality.
* Partner with stakeholders across the People team, Finance & Strategy, Sales Operations, and other stakeholders to understand business requirements, develop strategies to meet data needs, and provide design documents for implementation.
* Communicate regularly on program/project plans, progress, blockers, and risks to cross-functional stakeholders and sponsors.
* Quickly solve process pain points in the moment. Identify opportunities for long-term process optimization and redesign, manage implementation of new processes or policies, and develop measures of success.
* Champion, role model, and embed Samsara's cultural principles (Focus on Customer Success, Build for the Long Term, Adopt a Growth Mindset, Be Inclusive, Win as a Team) as we scale globally and across new offices


**Minimum requirements for the role:**


* Technical or Business degree or equivalent.
* 8+ years of relevant experience in a business intelligence and/or data analyst role, with a proven track record of delivering quality dashboards and/or actionable insights
* Advanced Tableau knowledge and experience in creating interactive and visually pleasing dashboards for consumption by non-technical stakeholders
* Excellent problem-solving and critical thinking skills, with the ability to think creatively to identify solutions to complex problems
* Experience working with cross-functional teams and collaborating with stakeholders at all levels of the organization
* Ability to communicate complex findings in a clear and concise manner to business leaders and stakeholders. Strong data visualization and storytelling skills are a must
* Strong attention to detail and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously


**An ideal candidate also has:**


* Specific coursework in information systems, statistics, programming, or data science
* Ability to manipulate large datasets programmatically with SQL
* Familiarity with Databricks and/or the medallion architecture design model for data warehousing
* Knowledge of standard People analytics metrics (ex: hire, promotion, transfer, & attrition rates)
* Familiarity with statistical analysis techniques, such as regression analysis, time series analysis, and hypothesis testing

**Samsara's Compensation Philosophy**: Samsara's compensation program is designed to deliver Total Direct Compensation (based on role, level, and geography) that is at or above market. We do this through our base salary + bonus/variable + restricted stock unit awards (RSUs) for eligible roles. For eligible roles, a new hire RSU award may be awarded at the time of hire, and additional RSU refresh grants may be awarded annually.



We pay for performance, and top performers in eligible roles may receive above-market equity refresh awards which allow employees to achieve higher market positioning.

**The range of annual base salary for full-time employees for this position is below. Please note that base pay offered may vary depending on factors including your city of residence, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.**


$95,795—$128,800 USD
At Samsara, we welcome everyone regardless of their background. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, and other characteristics protected by law. We depend on the unique approaches of our team members to help us solve complex problems. We are committed to increasing diversity across our team and ensuring that Samsara is a place where people from all backgrounds can make an impact.


**Benefits**



Full time employees receive a competitive total compensation package along with employee-led remote and flexible working, health benefits, Samsara for Good charity fund, and much, much more. Take a look at our Benefits site to learn more.


**Accommodations**



Samsara is an inclusive work environment, and we are committed to ensuring equal opportunity in employment for qualified persons with disabilities. Please email accessibleinterviewing@samsara.com or **click here**if you require any reasonable accommodations throughout the recruiting process.


**Flexible Working**



At Samsara, we have adopted a flexible way of working, enabling teams and individuals to do their best work, regardless of where they're based. We value in-person collaboration and know a change of scenery and quiet space to work is welcomed from time to time, but also appreciate that the world of work has changed. Our offices remain open for those who prefer to collaborate or work in-office, but we also encourage fully remote applicants. As most roles are not required to be in the office, we are able to hire remotely where Samsara has an established presence. If a role is required to be in a certain location and candidates do not have work authorization for that location, Samsara will conduct an immigration assessment. If the role is not required to be in a specific location, Samsara will move forward with the remote location that works best for the business. All offers of employment are contingent upon an individual's ability to secure and maintain the legal right to work at the company.

  



Please be aware that Samsara does not accept or assume responsibility for unsolicited resumes from agencies. We do not charge fees to applicants at any stage of the hiring process. Official communication about your application will only come from emails ending in '@Samsara.com' or '@us-greenhouse-mail.io'.

title: Sr. IOT Architect @ Remote - EST Time Zone
description:
**Position: Sr. IOT Architect**

**Location: Remote**

**Duration: Full Time**

**Job Description:**

The Sr. IoT Architect will be responsible for solutioning, designing and overseeing the implementation of loT solutions. The role will involve creating comprehensive architecture for connecting devices, data, and applications, cloud hosting, ensuring scalability, security, and efficiency.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Develop IoT architecture strategies for scalable, reliable, and secure connections between devices, cloud services, and user interfaces.
* Lead architectural design discussions and decisions for IoT solutions.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate loT technologies with existing systems.
* Evaluate and recommend lot devices and platforms based on project requirements.
* Ensure loT solutions comply with industry standards and best practices.
* Mentor and guide junior architects and developers.

**Required Skills and Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's or master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
* Minimum of 10-12 years' experience in loT systems design and development.
* Strong understanding of loT protocols, such as MQTT, AMQP, CoAP, and HTTP.
* Proficiency with cloud platforms, preferably Azure IoT services.
* Experience with security and privacy principles in loT contexts.
* Excellent leadership and communication skills.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $130,000.00 - $160,000.00 per year

Work Location: Remote

title: Enterprise Asset Management integration Lead - Remote
description:
**About Us:**



Cognizant is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating, and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build, and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant, a member of the NASDAQ-100, is ranked 195 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com.

  


**About Cognizant’s IoT Practice:**



Intelligent, IoT-enabled products will soon result in the proliferation of data and disrupt virtually all industries. To be successful, both large and small companies must leverage IoT capabilities by designing modern products that fundamentally connect people with processes. Within Cognizant IOT, we engineer industry-aligned, IoT-enabled products that merge industry needs with human drivers. Our intelligent products will revolutionize experiences and result in exciting, transformative outcomes. Without human-centered thinking, connected products are just standalone things—but with it, our modern connected products facilitate a unified way of life enjoyed by all.

  


**Required Technologies**

Deep understanding of Electricity (Utilities) Distribution domain



Knowhow of Asset Management Application used in Energy and Utilities space.



Nuclear and Asset Suite Experience a plus

  


**Job Description:**

Detailed overview of functional and technical role expectations This job requires skills and experience in one or more of the following areas:



We are seeking analysts to be responsible for defining software solutions based on client requirements for maintenance, work & asset management, supply chain, scheduling, financials, or other similar commercial off the shelf enterprise software solutions. Focus areas include technical systems analysts, functional analysts, business process definition, mobile app functional design, application testing, or integration analysts.

  




**Background:**



Ability to successfully work remotely, remain flexible, while balancing multiple priorities and meeting deadlines.


Entrepreneurial orientated; comfortable in smaller, growth-oriented settings.


Ability to admit but learn from mistakes.


Highly organized problem solver.


Thrives in a fast-paced atmosphere.


Strong sense of responsibility and ownership.


Detail-oriented and committed to accuracy.


Independent thinker and self-starter.


Strong time management.


Excellent written and verbal communication skills.


Attention to detail.


Background in at least one of these areas:


Application Testing, Automated Testing, Compliance.


Application Operations, Applications Management, Application Delivery.


Knowledge of process mapping and process re-engineering. Experience in designing and developing relevant enhancements on top of industry COTS (Commercial Off the Shelf) applications.


Background in Maintenance, Work & Asset Management, Supply Chain, Financials such as Asset Suite (preferred), or Maximo, SAP, PeopleSoft, or equivalent solutions.

  




**Responsibilities:**



Capture, document, analyze, trace, prioritize and gain client approval of the customer requirements and high-level design of Asset Suite extensions, webservices, batch jobs, reports, or interfaces to replace legacy customizations.


Work with developers to define coding solutions to address the customer’s requirements based on Asset Suite best practice and workflows.


Document the configuration elements of the extension including preferences and codes, security roles and events required.


Perform the testing of the deliverables, work with the developers to resolve issues to deliver a high-quality solution.


Prepare the work package for each extension for delivery to the customer. Conduct reviews of the work package to ensure it meets standards for quality, accuracy, and completeness.


Involves in Asset Suite Upgrade activities and integration, detailed design creation and code development.



Works with various application groups responsible for requirement gathering and Interface design specification creation.



Interface Design Specifications and reviews



Application Interface development, unit test & code reviews


Code migrations and version controls


Technical Infrastructure setups & readiness


Support Testing Activities

  


**Qualifications:**



Technical Skills: Cobol, Groovy, Compose, NXaxium, Oracle SQL, Fusion



Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent required.



10+ years of experience in business process consulting or direct utilities industry experience.



Creative problem solver.



Passion for transforming our clients’ businesses to unlock value for their shareholders, clients, and partners.



Ability to travel to customer location on need basis.



Ability to work as part of a cross-cultural team, including flexibility to support multiple time zones when necessary.

  


**Preferred**



Nuclear industry experience



Preferred Skills Cobol, Groovy, Compose, NXaxium, Oracle SQL, Fusion

  


**Work Authorization**



Cognizant will only consider applicants for this position who are legally authorized to work in the United States without company sponsorship.

  


**Compensation: -**



The annual salary for this position is between $130,000 – $150,000 depending on experience and other qualifications of the successful candidate.



This position is also eligible for Cognizant’s discretionary annual incentive program, based on performance and subject to the terms of Cognizant’s applicable plans.



Application will accept until – 04/13/2024.

  


**Benefits**: Cognizant offers the following benefits for this position, subject to applicable eligibility requirements:


* Medical/Dental/Vision/Life Insurance


* Paid holidays plus Paid Time Off


* 401(k) plan and contributions


* Long-term/Short-term Disability


* Paid Parental Leave


* Employee Stock Purchase Plan

  



Disclaimer: The salary, other compensation, and benefits information is accurate as of the date of this posting. Cognizant reserves the right to modify this information at any time, subject to applicable law.



We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. title: FULL STACK (FRONT/BACK END) Software Developer- REMOTE
description:
Leedo is seeking a full stack .NET Software Developer (MUST HAVE EXPERIENCE WITH C#, VB.NET, ASP.NET, AZURE, AND BLAZER). The developers play a pivotal role in the evolution of existing and future software platforms that serve as the backbone to Leedo’s sales and manufacturing processes. We are expanding our developer team in order to accelerate support of the business needs leveraging technology to provide world class manufacturing efficiency, quality of products and customer service and support.



As with any growing company, Leedo’s systems are a combination of new and old technology and successful candidates will have working knowledge of the legacy and current .NET ecosystems as well as awareness of the evolution of .NET.

  


**Essential Functions:**


* Maintain and Update existing VBA (Access and Excel) applications as required
* Maintain and Update existing .NET 4.5 WinForms and Web Applications
* Maintain and Update existing .NET Core Console, UWP and Web Applications
* Create and Manage New Development Projects

  


**Minimum Qualifications:**


* .NET Development Experience
* Proficient with Microsoft Visual Studio and TFS / Azure DevOps
* Web – HTML, JavaScript / TypeScript, CSS, ASP.NET, MVC
* Desktop – WinForms, UWP, XAML, Console Apps
* Intimate Knowledge of C#, .NET Core, Entity Framework and LINQ
* Understanding of SQL Server Management Studio and SQL Queries
* Ability to work with end users to provide solutions

  


**Beneficial Qualifications:**


* Microsoft Identity Framework
* Experience Developing SQL Server Reporting Services Reports
* Experience Optimizing SQL Queries
* IoT Experience with Raspberry Pi or Similar Platforms with an Emphasis on Windows IoT
* Experience Developing Cross Platform Applications with Xamarin
* Familiarity with Azure Event Hub, Azure Functions, …

  


**Personal Attributes:**


* Results oriented
* Self-Starter / Self-Manager
* Problem solving skills
* Effective communication skills
* Ability to work in a fast paced, high-growth and rapidly changing environment.

  


**AN EQUAL-OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER**

  



Leedo Manufacturing CO., L.P. does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, ancestry, age, religion, military and veteran status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, pregnancy, or any other legally-protected characteristic; and it will comply with all applicable state, federal, and municipal discrimination laws. No person will be denied employment solely because of a disability, provided that the person can perform the essential functions of the position for which the person has applied, either with or without reasonable accommodations.

title: Chief Technology Officer USA
description:
**PALO IT** is an international consultancy in technological innovation and agile software development dedicated to helping organizations embrace exponential change through sustainability. We work with clients to quickly launch products and services, create new business models, and prepare leadership and culture for the future.


**The Challenge:** We are looking for a Chief Technology Officer in USA. We bring with us all the excitement and freedom of starting operations in a new country with the stability and resources of a large organization. Our Technical Leader must be able to participate in both the creation of our commercial offerings and the delivery of the projects won. Our DNA is oriented towards Sustainability, new technologies and OpenSource. We are a company passionate about technical challenges and work only on innovation projects. In addition, you will have access to an international knowledge pool shared between Asia, Europe, and Americas.


**Our Culture:** PALO IT is a consultancy specializing in UX/UI design, software development, and agile transformation. Our mission is to use technology to bring positive impact to our clients. We have over 10 years of experience working with multinational companies using these methodologies. In short, we help companies remember how to innovate. Need a shift towards the future? Let's do the groundwork. Our team has the attitude and experience to build new products and platforms from scratch. The lifespan of a PALO IT project extends far beyond delivery. The products we manufacture are designed to mature with our clients and grow along with our ever-changing market. We use technology as a force for good. Sustainability is a fundamental value for every project we touch and every action our organization takes. We are currently building our business on five continents, but we are also building the communities we are part of. If you want to shape a better world, dream big, and want to make things happen, get in touch with us.


**The Role:** We are looking for a business-focused enterprise technology leader. Often the requirements for a new project are ambiguous. Your responsibility as a CTO will lead you to solve these challenges. You will build your path in collaboration with the Managing Director of USA and the CTO of the region. You will assume a leadership role in technical architecture, development, and building technical teams.


**Responsibilities:** You will oversee all aspects of the engineering organization, including technical strategy, architecture planning, hiring, and retaining our talents. You will be the guardian of the proper follow-up of best practices and the selection of the best technical frameworks. You will manage project development from start to finish and be the commercial area partner for the proper development of commercial offers. You will own the engineering budget and key decisions on technical architecture. You will not be alone. You will have the support of our office in Mexico and particularly the Americas CTO.


**Skills and Competencies Required:**


* Previous experience in creating development tools or products intended for front-end and back-end developers.
* A high degree of empathy with the user and actively seek to test, learn, and iterate based on user feedback.
* Motivated to found a business from its creation and can dedicate full time to the challenge.
* Previous startup experience is an advantage, as is experience working with distributed teams.
* Well connected with the developer community and can attract the right engineering team.
* Experience in engineering management in a high-growth startup or a medium-sized technology company focused on development.
* Your track record demonstrates deliveries of well-designed developments with modern technologies for a variety of different domains.
* Excited about creating a new business and the idea of fostering high-level technological teams.
* Enjoy being a mentor and guiding each of your collaborators in their professional and technical development.
* Like to get up in the morning to go to work. Your enthusiasm and technical level will help you define and promote a culture of engineering oriented towards technical excellence.
* Interested in growing our developer community and being the best ambassador of Palo-IT internally and outside the office.
* Autonomous and have a great appetite for experimenting with new technologies and tools to drive innovation and creativity.
* Have worked in a diverse set of full-stack technologies, including web, mobile, data, and infrastructure.


**You should be familiar with the following Technologies and Methodologies:**


* Agility: Scrum, Kanban, Lean, XP, Design Thinking, Design Sprint, ExO Framework, Agile Transformation (Coaching and Scaling)
* Architecture: Blackboard, Client-server, Component-based, Data-centric, Event-driven, Multilayered architecture, Microservices and Monolithic application, Service Mesh
* Languages: Javascript, Kotlin, .Net (C#), Java, Golang, Python, Rust, PHP, R, Ruby on Rails, Clojure, Dart
* Cloud: Aws, Azure, Watson, GCP and perfect understanding of IaaS, PaaS, SaaS, FaaS concepts
* DevOps: CI/CD, Docker, Kubernetes, Docker Swarm, Vagrant, Vault, Perfect understanding of the concept of containers
* UX/UI: Speed Prototyping, Zeplin, Sketch, Invision, Atomic Design, Bootstrap, Material Design, Design System
* OS: Expert in Linux and knowledge in Windows administration. MacOS/\\*BSD are a plus
* Other tools: Maven, Ant, Gradle, Jenkins, Pmd, Linter, Google Tools, Code-Reviewing, Jmeter, Jprofiler, Git, Svn, Veracode, Sonarqube, Prometheus, Snort, Splunk, Nagios, Saltstack, JFrog, Ansible, Puppet, Chef, ELK, Nginx
* Framework/Library: Spring, Vert.x, Helidon, Quarkus, Mockito, React, Angular, Vue.js, Istio, Consul, Flutter
* Application Servers: Tomcat 5, Jetty, Weblogic, Glassfish, JBoss Database: SQL / NOSQL
* Distributed Application: Hadoop, MapReduce, HBase, ZooKeeper, Hive, Pig
* API Gateway: Kong, Tyk, Apigee, and alternatives
* Technological Trends: IoT, Big Data, Blockchain, Robotics, NoCode


**Benefits:** This offer is an incredible opportunity to accompany the growth of operations in USA with the support of an international group. You will learn a lot and will work and meet exceptional talents. You will also learn faster than ever and have direct support from the office in Mexico. You will have the freedom to execute, build businesses, and new innovative products.  

  

Don't hesitate to reach if you're interested, it will be a pleasure to know more about you!

title: Sr Cloud Engineering Manager, Digital Foundry
description:
**Country:**

United States of America**Location:**

CAWIO: Carrier-Home Wisconsin Remote Location, Remote City, WI, 53001 USA
Carrier is the leading global provider of healthy, safe and sustainable building and cold chain solutions with a world-class, diverse workforce with business segments covering HVAC, refrigeration, and fire and security. We make modern life possible by delivering safer, smarter and more sustainable services that make a difference to people and our planet while revolutionizing industry trends. This is why we come to work every day. Join us and we can make a difference together.

**About this role**


Carrier’s software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how Carrier products connect and interact with information and one another. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, and user experience; the list goes on and is growing every day. As an engineering manager, you will work on a specific product critical to Carrier’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and products as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineering managers to be versatile, display leadership qualities, and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full stack as we continue to push technology forward.


This role reports to the Associate Director of Software Engineering for a specific Carrier product. This role has as direct reports the individual development team leads. The role is paired with one or more Product Managers, who are responsible for developing the overall product vision and ideating, researching, defining, prioritizing, and documenting product requirements and designs at the feature level. The product team jointly is responsible for the product roadmap, release planning, feature definition, and strong customer advocacy.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Single-threaded ownership of the state of delivery across your teams. You know and report on what’s on track, what’s on fire, and escalate when plan and reality diverge.
* Set a bold vision for a high-performing software delivery lifecycle (SDLC) and influence leaders in your team to define and improve key performance indicators (KPIs) to meet that vision.
* Build and maintain a fail-fast culture that learns from mistakes to continuously improve reliability of operated software products.
* Meet regularly with development team members to review performance, progress on individual goals, provide feedback and coaching. Set clear expectations with development team members based on their level and role aligned to the broader organization's goals.
* Manage pipeline of resources to be hired. Scope and deliver candidate interviews.
* Coach and grow development team members to the next stages of their careers.
* Review code as needed and provide feedback to ensure adoption of the best practices of software delivery are being met such as code legibility, quality, testability, and efficiency.

**Basic Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree
* Minimum of 10 years delivering production software in one or more roles and levels
* Minimum of 5 years delivering software products using Agile methodologies
* Minimum of 3 years shipping solutions using cloud computing methodologies and vendors such as AWS, Microsoft Azure, or Google Cloud Platform
* Minimum of 3 years delivering software using service-oriented, micro-service, or serverless architectures.
* Minimum of 1 year leading a globally distributed team

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree preferably in computer science or computer engineering
* Active or expired professional certification for project management such as PMP, Scrum, or Agile
* Active or expired professional certification for cloud architecture such as AWS Solutions Architect Associate
* Use of Atlassian products (JIRA/Confluence/Bitbucket) for definition, tracking, and delivery of software projects
* Previous experience as a software developer shipping web applications as a senior developer or team lead
* Previous experience delivering software projects in the domain of Internet of Things (IoT) or industrial edge
* Detail oriented – you can see the big picture and break it down into small, digestible chunks
* Passion for and understanding of technology – working knowledge of modern, cloud-based technology. Distributed computing expertise is a bonus
* Great communication – you can help product owners translate requirements and designs into clear user stories, and communicate across product and technical teams to ensure requirements are understood and actionable
* Business acumen – desire to understand how each new feature delights customers and impacts the business
* Proven record of successfully delivering software with remote and globally distributed teams


#LI-remote


RSRCAR

**Carrier is An Equal** **Opportunity/Affirmative** **Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class.**

**Job Applicant's Privacy Notice:**


Click on this link to read the Job Applicant's Privacy Notice

title: Principal UX Designer
description:
Accepting remote candidates in the following states: Arizona, California, Colorado, Delaware, Florida, Georgia, Maryland, Minnesota, Nevada, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Tennessee, Texas, Virginia, Washington, and Wisconsin.

TensorIoT is looking for a Principal UX Designer with an excellent understanding of everything human-centered to join our design team.

As a Principal UX Designer, you will play an instrumental role in collaborating with our development teams and customers to create world-class designs and solutions. You will also help improve our design processes by integrating design thinking into our current development workflow. The ideal candidate will have outstanding analytical and creative problem-solving fundamentals to deliver intuitive, pleasing design solutions. Some travel may be required.

**As a Principal UX Designer, you will:**

* Collaborate with cross-functional teams of developers, designers, sales, marketing, project managers, and leadership
* Design intuitive and elegant experiences for a variety of screen sizes including mobile and desktop
* Work closely with developers to ensure the final product provides an amazing experience from start to finish
* Interface with clients and stakeholders to gather requirements, business goals, and feedback
* Validate your work with a variety of techniques such as research and user testing, using UX best practices and data to inform design decisions
* Advocate for the user, while also balancing the business needs and requirements of the client
* Effectively communicate and articulate design decisions to developers and clients
* Rapidly prototype concepts to illustrate your ideas to others
* Help establish and improve current design procedures and guidelines
* Provide mentorship to other designers on the team

**We’re looking for someone who has:**

* 8+ years of experience as a UX Designer, Product Designer, Interaction Designer, or similar
* Deep understanding of, and experience with, the full UX design process, including UX research and testing, information architecture, user flows, wireframes, and high-fidelity mockups
* Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, especially in storytelling
* A strong portfolio of previous design projects
* End-to-end creative problem solving skills
* Expertise in Figma
* Experience in customer-facing roles, especially presenting designs and demos to customers for feedback and sign-off
* The ability to find the optimal balance of user experience, business goals, and technical requirements
* The ability to quickly learn new skills and systems, and work efficiently in a fast-paced consulting environment
* Excellent organizational, time, and project management skills, and an attention to detail
* Preference for working in a cross-functional environment
* A curious mind - loves to ask questions and tactfully challenge assumptions
* A proactive approach - always on the lookout for ways to take initiative and go the extra mile
* The ability to create visually stunning graphic designs and animations
* Experience leading teams or mentoring other designers

**Bonus points for someone with:**

* Experience designing both business-to-consumer (B2C) and business-to-business applications (B2B)
* Experience working in a small business and wearing many hats
* Experience designing information visualizations and dashboards in business intelligence (BI) tools, such as QuickSight, Grafana, or Tableau
* An interest in IoT, Machine Learning, and Artificial Intelligence
* Familiarity with Agile or Scrum workflows, especially using the Jira platform
* Experience designing applications built on the AWS platform, and/or an AWS certification
